metadata.Title: CVE-2023-31083 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/bluetooth/hci_ldisc.c in the Linux kernel 6.2. In hci_uart_tty_ioctl, there is a race condition between HCIUARTSETPROTO and HCIUARTGETPROTO. HCI_UART_PROTO_SET is set before hu->proto is set. A NULL pointer dereference may occur. Yu Hao and Weiteng Chen discovered that the Bluetooth HCI UART driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230
